title: Authors and Citation
text: James Churchward. Author, maintainer, copyright holder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Churchward J (2023). DivInsight: Diversity Index Calculation & Visualisation Taxa Location. R package version 0.1.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {DivInsight: Diversity Index Calculation & Visualisation for Taxa and Location},   author = {James Churchward},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.1.0}, }

title: Cluster Occurrence Data — clusterise_sites
text: Cluster occurrence data date option group cluster using specified radius distance. clusters data represents site pair centered coordinates site generated.

title: Cluster Occurrence Data — clusterise_sites
text: dataframe dataframe occurrence data chosen taxon location. cluster_min_length minimum number observations cluster. group_radius optional value sites grouped. Group radius measured metres. day_split_min_length default function filters days fewer 10 observations. value adjusts minimum threshold.

title: Cluster Occurrence Data — clusterise_sites
text: function returns 'clusterised object', list containing two elements: first element list data clusters. second element dataframe includes centred coordinates site, group number, date.

title: Cluster Occurrence Data (large dataframe) — clusterise_sites_large_dataframe
text: Cluster large occurrence dataframe date option group cluster using specified radius distance. clusters data represents site pair centered coordinates site generated.

title: Cluster Occurrence Data (large dataframe) — clusterise_sites_large_dataframe
text: dataframe dataframe occurrence data chosen taxon location. cluster_min_length minimum number observations cluster. day_split_min_length default function filters days fewer 10 observations. value adjusts minimum threshold. group_radius optional value sites grouped. Group radius measured metres.

title: Cluster Occurrence Data (large dataframe) — clusterise_sites_large_dataframe
text: function returns 'clusterised object', list containing two elements: first element list data clusters. second element dataframe includes centred coordinates site, group number, date.

what: Occurence data of the Formicidae family in Colombia from 2000 to 2023 — Colombia

Occurence data of the Formicidae family in Colombia from 2000 to 2023 — Colombia
text: ## `Colombia` data frame 190810 rows 188 columns: decimalLongitude Longitude occurence decimalLatitude Latitude occurence

title: Occurence data of the Formicidae family in Colombia from 2000 to 2023 — Colombia
text: Queried Global Biodiversity Information Facility database.

what: DivInsight: Diversity Index Calculation & Visualisation for Taxa and Location — DivInsight-package
title: DivInsight: Diversity Index Calculation & Visualisation for Taxa and Location — DivInsight-package
text: Repurpose occurrence data calculating diversity index values, creating visuals, generating species composition matrices chosen taxon location.

title: DivInsight: Diversity Index Calculation & Visualisation for Taxa and Location — DivInsight-package
text: Maintainer: James Churchward jameschurchward1@outlook.com [copyright holder]

title: Filter Group by Size — filter_groups_by_minsize
text: Filter clusterised object removing groups specified size.

title: Filter Group by Size — filter_groups_by_minsize
text: clusterised_object object created clusterise_sites functions. min_group_size minimum size group.

title: Filter Group by Size — filter_groups_by_minsize
text: new clusterised object groups least specified minimum size.

title: Filter Group by Name — filter_groups_by_number
text: Filter clusterised object assigned groups remove groups specified label.

title: Filter Group by Name — filter_groups_by_number
text: clusterised_object object created clusterise_sites function. group_number number identifies group extracted.

title: Filter Group by Name — filter_groups_by_number
text: new clusterised object contains sites specified group.

title: Convert GBIF Object — gbif_to_dataframe
text: Convert GBIF object workable R dataframe.

title: Convert GBIF Object — gbif_to_dataframe
text: GBIF_object object queried GBIF database: list containing occurrence data specified taxon location.

title: Convert GBIF Object — gbif_to_dataframe
text: R dataframe containing occurrence data GBIF object.

title: Convert GBIF Object — gbif_to_dataframe
code: # convert the GBIF object containing occurrence plant data from 2020 and 2019 # \donttest{  library(rgbif)   Cambodia_code <- isocodes[grep("Cambodia", isocodes$name), "code"]   Plant_taxonkey <- name_backbone("Plantae")$kingdomKey   plant_cambodia.gbif <- occ_search(    hasCoordinate = TRUE,    limit = 99990,    taxonKey = Plant_taxonkey,    year = c("2020", "2019"),    country = Cambodia_code  )   plant_cambodia.df <- gbif_to_dataframe(plant_cambodia.gbif)   head(plant_cambodia.df) #> # A tibble: 6 × 100 #>   key        scientificName   decimalLatitude decimalLongitude issues datasetKey #>   <chr>      <chr>                      <dbl>            <dbl> <chr>  <chr>      #> 1 2611167460 Murdannia macro…            11.5             103. cdc    50c9509d-… #> 2 2609083086 Bruguiera gymno…            11.5             103. cdc    50c9509d-… #> 3 2563487184 Cerbera manghas…            11.5             103. cdc    50c9509d-… #> 4 2563542656 Artocarpus hete…            13.4             104. cdc,c… 50c9509d-… #> 5 2609083379 Anacardium occi…            11.8             106. cdc,c… 50c9509d-… #> 6 2963951351 Calotropis giga…            11.7             105. cdc,c… 50c9509d-… #> # ℹ 94 more variables: publishingOrgKey <chr>, installationKey <chr>, #> #   hostingOrganizationKey <chr>, publishingCountry <chr>, protocol <chr>, #> #   lastCrawled <chr>, lastParsed <chr>, crawlId <int>, basisOfRecord <chr>, #> #   occurrenceStatus <chr>, taxonKey <int>, kingdomKey <int>, phylumKey <int>, #> #   classKey <int>, orderKey <int>, familyKey <int>, genusKey <int>, #> #   speciesKey <int>, acceptedTaxonKey <int>, acceptedScientificName <chr>, #> #   kingdom <chr>, phylum <chr>, order <chr>, family <chr>, genus <chr>, … # }

title: Generate Species Composition Matrix — generate_speccomm
text: Create species composition matrix using list species tables.

title: Generate Species Composition Matrix — generate_speccomm
text: spec_table_list list species tables created generate_spec_tables function.

title: Generate Species Composition Matrix — generate_speccomm
text: species composition matrix

title: Generate Species Composition Matrix — generate_speccomm

title: Generate Species Tables — generate_spec_tables
text: Generate list tables species counts input clusterised object.

title: Generate Species Tables — generate_spec_tables
text: clusterised_object object created clusterise_sites function. min_individuals minimum number individuals table min_species minimum number species table.

title: Generate Species Tables — generate_spec_tables
text: list species counts tables.

title: Generate Species Tables — generate_spec_tables
code: # generate species count tables with a minimum of 30 individuals from 5 species Colombia_Caquetá_dataframe <- subset(Colombia, stateProvince == "Caquetá")  clusterised_Caquetá <- clusterise_sites(dataframe = Colombia_Caquetá_dataframe,                                        cluster_min_length = 30,                                        group_radius = 20000 )  Spec_Tables_Caquetá <- generate_spec_tables(   clusterised_object = clusterised_Caquetá,  min_individuals = 30,  min_species = 5  )  print(Spec_Tables_Caquetá$`5.2016-03-22`) #>  #>                         Acromyrmex coronatus (Fabricius, 1804)  #>                                                              1  #>                                           Acropyga Roger, 1862  #> title: Generate Species Tables — generate_spec_tables_df
code: # generate species count tables with a minimum of 30 individuals from 5 species Colombia_Caquetá_dataframe <- subset(Colombia, stateProvince == "Caquetá")  Spec_Tables_Caquetá <- generate_spec_tables_df(   dataframe = Colombia_Caquetá_dataframe,  min_individuals = 30,  min_species = 5  )  print(Spec_Tables_Caquetá$`2016-03-22`) #>  #>                         Acromyrmex title: Generate Diversity Index Statistics — generate_stats
text: Calculates diversity index values site clusterised object.

title: Generate Diversity Index Statistics — generate_stats
text: clusterised_object object created clusterise_sites function.

title: Generate Diversity Index Statistics — generate_stats
text: dataframe row pertains site column higher taxa labels, time & location data, well diversity index values.

title: Generate Diversity Index Statistics — generate_stats
code: # generate species count tables with a minimum of 30 individuals from 5 species Colombia_Caquetá_dataframe <- subset(Colombia, stateProvince == "Caquetá")  clusterised_Caquetá <- clusterise_sites(dataframe = Colombia_Caquetá_dataframe,                                        cluster_min_length = 30,                                        group_radius = 20000 )  stats_Caquetá <- generate_stats(clusterised_Caquetá)  head(stats_Caquetá) #>   longitude latitude site_group       date year month day  country #> 1 -75.54658 1.558959          1 2008-06-01 2008     6   1 Colombia #> 2 -75.81619 1.339552          2 2008-06-01 2008     6   1 Colombia #> 3 -75.78822 1.289720          2 2016-03-08 2016     3   8 Colombia #> 4 -75.78894 1.267924          2 2019-02-08 2019     2   8 Colombia #> 5 -75.65327 1.441539          3 2016-03-09 2016     3   9 Colombia #> 6 -75.66336 1.456000          3 2016-03-16 2016     3  16 Colombia #>   stateProvince  kingdom     phylum   class  S        H         D      Dinv #> 1       Caquetá Animalia Arthropoda Insecta 53 3.672516 0.9648459 28.446154 #> 2       Caquetá Animalia Arthropoda Insecta 37 3.414379 0.9605243 25.332046 #> 3       Caquetá Animalia Arthropoda Insecta  9 1.901906 0.8117284  5.311475 #> 4       Caquetá Animalia Arthropoda Insecta 24 2.970650 0.9396085 16.558621 #> 5       Caquetá Animalia Arthropoda Insecta 27 3.012315 0.9378698 16.095238 #> 6       Caquetá Animalia Arthropoda Insecta 19 2.787044 0.9256055 13.441860 #>           d         J day_length #> 1 10.700001 0.9249990   12.20434 #> 2  8.192153 0.9455709   12.19245 #> 3  2.232443 0.8655948   12.09705 #> 4  5.909831 0.9347388   12.06910 #> 5  6.580207 0.9139758   12.09661 #> 6  5.104413 0.9465451   12.10555

text: existing_map map object created using map_start function. clusterised_object object created clusterise_sites functions. site_name optional label add coordinate pins. colour colour coordinate pins.

title: Add to Site Map — map_add
text: Coordinate pins added existing interactive map object.

title: Create Site Map — map_start
text: Create interactive map using centred site coordinates.

title: Create Site Map — map_start
text: clusterised_object object created clusterise_sites function. site_name optional label add coordinate pins. colour colour coordinate pins.

title: Create Site Map — map_start
text: Viewer object: interactive map.

title: Plot H against Date — plot_sites_scatter_H
text: Plot Shannon's H Y axis dates X axis scaled spacing date scattered points.

title: Plot H against Date — plot_sites_scatter_H
code: plot_sites_scatter_H(   clusterised_object,   xlabel = "Date",   ylabel = "Diversity (H)",   main_title = "Shannon's H over Time" )

title: Plot H against Date — plot_sites_scatter_H
text: clusterised_object object created clusterise_sites function. xlabel X axis label "Date" default. ylabel Y axis label "Diversity (H)" default. main_title main label "Shannon's H Time" default.

title: Plot H against Date — plot_sites_scatter_H
text: Returns ggplot2 scatter plot plot panel, showing relationship dates diversity index values.

title: Plot H against Date — plot_sites_scatter_H
code: # create a scatter plot showing the diversity over time at the Caquetá province Colombia_Caquetá_dataframe <- subset(Colombia, stateProvince == "Caquetá")  clusterised_Caquetá <- clusterise_sites(dataframe = Colombia_Caquetá_dataframe,                                        cluster_min_length = 30,                                        group_radius = 20000 )  plot_sites_scatter_H(clusterised_Caquetá) #> Warning: Use of `stats_dataframe$date` is discouraged. #> ℹ Use `date` instead. #> Warning: Use of `stats_dataframe$H` is discouraged. #> ℹ Use `H` instead.

title: Plot H against Date — plot_sites_trend_H
text: Plot Shannon's H Y axis dates X axis uniform spacing date line best fit.

title: Plot H against Date — plot_sites_trend_H
code: plot_sites_trend_H(   clusterised_object,   xlabel = "",   ylabel = "Diversity (H)",   main_title = "Shannon's H over Time" )

title: Plot H against Date — plot_sites_trend_H
text: clusterised_object object created clusterise_sites function. xlabel X axis label. ylabel Y axis label "Diversity (H)" default. main_title main title "Shannon's H Time" default.

title: Plot H against Date — plot_sites_trend_H
text: Returns base R plot plot panel, depicting trend diversity index values time.

title: Plot H against Date — plot_sites_trend_H
code: # create a trend chart showing the diversity over time at the Caquetá province Colombia_Caquetá_dataframe <- subset(Colombia, stateProvince == "Caquetá")  clusterised_Caquetá <- clusterise_sites(dataframe = Colombia_Caquetá_dataframe,                                        cluster_min_length = 30,                                        group_radius = 20000 )  plot_sites_trend_H(clusterised_Caquetá)

title: Subset Occurrence Dataframe — subset_by_coordinate_ref
text: Subsets occurrence dataframe using pair reference coordinates radius distance.

title: Subset Occurrence Dataframe — subset_by_coordinate_ref
text: dataframe dataframe occurrence data subset coordinate_reference pair longitude/latitude coordinates mark centre occurrence data distance_threshold distance coordinate reference included subset

title: Subset Occurrence Dataframe — subset_by_coordinate_ref
text: dataframe observations occurred within distance threshold coordinate reference

title: Subset Occurrence Dataframe — subset_by_coordinate_ref
code: # subset the occurrence data returning only data points 50km from the reference coordinates Colombia_site_1 <-  subset_by_coordinate_ref(   dataframe = Colombia,  coordinate_reference = c(-74.083310, 7.488485),  distance_threshold = 50000  )  head(Colombia_site_1) #> # A tibble: 6 × 188 #>   key        scientificName   decimalLatitude decimalLongitude issues datasetKey #>   <chr>      <chr>                      <dbl>            <dbl> <chr>  <chr>      #> 1 3944682607 Ectatomma ruidu…            7.36            -73.9 ""     9f11d995-… #> 2 3944682606 Paratrechina lo…            7.36            -73.9 ""     9f11d995-… #> 3 3944682605 Hypoponera Sant…            7.36            -73.9 ""     9f11d995-… #> 4 3944682604 Nylanderia Emer…            7.36            -73.9 ""     9f11d995-… #> 5 3944682603 Pheidole Westwo…            7.36            -73.9 ""     9f11d995-… #> 6 3944682602 Octostruma Fore…            7.36            -73.9 ""     9f11d995-… #> # ℹ 182 more variables: publishingOrgKey <chr>, installationKey <chr>, #> #   hostingOrganizationKey <chr>, publishingCountry <chr>, protocol <chr>, #> #   lastCrawled <chr>, lastParsed <chr>, crawlId <int>, basisOfRecord <chr>, #> #   individualCount <int>, occurrenceStatus <chr>, taxonKey <int>, #> #   kingdomKey <int>, phylumKey <int>, classKey <int>, orderKey <int>, #> #   familyKey <int>, genusKey <int>, speciesKey <int>, acceptedTaxonKey <int>, #> #   acceptedScientificName <chr>, kingdom <chr>, phylum <chr>, order <chr>, …
